getOrbitalZone

public static int getOrbitalZone(double luminosity,
                                 double orbRadius)
This function, given the orbital radius of a planet in AU, returns the orbital 'zone' of the particle.

Parameters:
luminosity - The stellar luminosity *Sol = 1.0)

The orbital zone of the planet

Get the radius of the volume for a specified mass

Parameters:

density - The density (in grams/cc)
Returns:
The orbital radius in km

getKothariRadius

public static double getKothariRadius(double mass,
                                      boolean giant,
                                      int zone)
Returns the radius of the planet in kilometers. This formula is listed as eq.9 in Fogg's article, although some typos crop up in that eq. See "The Internal Constitution of Planets", by Dr. D. S. Kothari, Mon. Not. of the Royal Astronomical Society, vol 96 pp.833-843, 1936 for the derivation. Specifically, this is Kothari's eq.23, which appears on page 840.

Parameters:
mass - The mass of the planet
giant - 
true
if the planet is a gas giant
zone - The orbital zone of the planet
Returns:
The radius of the planet in Kilometres

getEmpiricalDensity

public static double getEmpiricalDensity(double mass,
                                         double orbRadius,
                                         double rEcosphere,
                                         boolean gasGiant)
The mass passed in is in units of solar masses, and the orbital radius is in units of AU. The density is returned in units of grams/cc.

Parameters:
mass - The mass in solar masses
orbRadius - The orbital radius in AU
rEcosphere - The radius of the stellar ecosphere
gasGiant - 
true
if this is a gas giant
Returns:
The density in grams/cc

getVolumeDensity

public static double getVolumeDensity(double mass,
                                      double equatorialRadius)
The massG passed in is in units of solar masses, and the radius is in units of km. The density is returned in units of grams/cc.

Parameters:
mass - The mass in solar masses
equatorialRadius - The planetary equatorial radius in AU
Returns:
The density in grams/cc

getBoilingPoint

public static double getBoilingPoint(double surfPressure)
This function returns the boiling point of water in an atmosphere of pressure 'surfPressure', given in millibars. The boiling point is returned in units of Kelvin. This is Fogg's eq.21.

Parameters:
surfPressure - The surface atmospheric pressure in millibars
Returns:
The corresponding boiling point of water in degrees Kelvin
